pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:0.5.eng: 15. The training rule on sitting blankets

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.2.pli: Atha kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi—“icchāmahaṃ, bhikkhave, temāsaṃ paṭisallīyituṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.2.eng: There the Buddha addressed the monks: “Monks, I wish to do a solitary retreat for three months.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.3.pli: Namhi kenaci upasaṅkamitabbo, aññatra ekena piṇḍapātanīhārakenā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.3.eng: No one should visit me except the one who brings me almsfood.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.4.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paṭissuṇitvā nāssudha koci bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamati, aññatra ekena piṇḍapātanīhārakena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.4.eng: “Yes, sir,” they replied, and no one visited him except the one who brought him almsfood.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.5.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sāvatthiyā saṅghena katikā katā hoti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.5.eng: Soon afterwards the Sangha at Sāvatthī made the following agreement:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.6.eng: “The Buddha wishes to be on solitary retreat for three months.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.7.pli: Na bhagavā kenaci upasaṅkamitabbo, aññatra ekena piṇḍapātanīhārakena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.7.eng: No one should visit him except the one who brings him almsfood.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.8.pli: Yo bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamati so pācittiyaṃ desāpetabbo”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.8.eng: Anyone who does must confess an offense entailing confession.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.9.pli: Atha kho āyasmā upaseno vaṅgantaputto, sapariso yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.9.eng: Just then Venerable Upasena of Vaṅganta and his followers went to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.10.pli: Āciṇṇaṃ kho panetaṃ buddhānaṃ bhagavantānaṃ āgantukehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ paṭisammodituṃ. Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ upasenaṃ vaṅgantaputtaṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.10.eng: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly-arrived monks, the Buddha said this to Upasena,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.11.eng: “I hope you’re keeping well, Upasena, I hope you’re getting by?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.12.eng: I hope you’re not tired from traveling?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.13.eng: “We’re keeping well, sir, we’re getting by.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.14.pli: Appakilamathena ca mayaṃ, bhante, addhānaṃ āgatā”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.15.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmato upasenassa vaṅgantaputtassa saddhivihāriko bhikkhu bhagavato avidūre nisinno hoti. Atha kho bhagavā taṃ bhikkhuṃ etadavoca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.15.eng: One of Upasena’s students was seated not far from the Buddha, and the Buddha said to him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.19.pli: “Upajjhāyo me, bhante, paṃsukūliko. Evaṃ ahampi paṃsukūliko”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.19.eng: “My preceptor wears them, and so I do it too.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.20.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṃ upasenaṃ vaṅgantaputtaṃ etadavoca—“pāsādikā kho tyāyaṃ, upasena, parisā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.20.eng: And the Buddha said to Upasena, “Upasena, your followers are inspiring.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.22.pli: “Yo maṃ, bhante, upasampadaṃ yācati tamahaṃ evaṃ vadāmi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.22.eng: “When anyone asks me for the full ordination, I tell him this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.23.eng: ‘I stay in the wilderness, I eat only almsfood, and I wear rag-robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.24.pli: Sace tvampi āraññiko bhavissasi piṇḍapātiko paṃsukūliko, evāhaṃ taṃ upasampādessāmī’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.24.eng: If you do the same, I’ll give you the full ordination.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.25.pli: Sace me paṭissuṇāti upasampādemi, no ce me paṭissuṇāti na upasampādemi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.25.eng: If he agrees, I ordain him. Otherwise I don’t.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.26.pli: Yo maṃ nissayaṃ yācati tamahaṃ evaṃ vadāmi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.26.eng: And I do the same when anyone asks me for support.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.26.comm: “Support” renders nissaya. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.28.pli: Sace tvampi āraññiko bhavissasi piṇḍapātiko paṃsukūliko, evāhaṃ te nissayaṃ dassāmī’ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.29.pli: Sace me paṭissuṇāti nissayaṃ demi, no ce me paṭissuṇāti na nissayaṃ demi.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.30.pli: Evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, parisaṃ vinemī”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.1.30.eng: It’s in this way that I train my followers.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.1.pli: “Sādhu sādhu, upasena. Sādhu kho tvaṃ, upasena, parisaṃ vinesi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.1.eng: “Good, Upasena, you train your followers well.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.2.pli: Jānāsi pana tvaṃ, upasena, sāvatthiyā saṅghassa katikan”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.2.eng: But do you know the agreement made by the Sangha at Sāvatthī?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.3.pli: “Na kho ahaṃ, bhante, jānāmi sāvatthiyā saṅghassa katikan”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.4.eng: “The Sangha at Sāvatthī has made the following agreement:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.5.eng: ‘The Buddha wishes to be on solitary retreat for three months.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.6.pli: Na bhagavā kenaci upasaṅkamitabbo, aññatra ekena piṇḍapātanīhārakena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.6.eng: No one should visit him except the one who brings him almsfood.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.7.pli: Yo bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamati so pācittiyaṃ desāpetabbo’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.7.eng: Anyone who does must confess an offense entailing confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.8.eng: “Sir, let the Sangha at Sāvatthī be known for this agreement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.9.pli: na mayaṃ apaññattaṃ paññapessāma paññattaṃ vā na samucchindissāma,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.9.eng: We, however, don’t lay down new rules, nor do we get rid of the existing ones.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.10.eng: We practice and undertake the training rules as they are.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.12.pli: apaññattaṃ na paññapetabbaṃ, paññattaṃ vā na samucchinditabbaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.12.eng: One should not lay down new rules, nor should one get rid of the existing ones.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.13.eng: One should practice and undertake the training rules as they are.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.14.pli: Anujānāmi, upasena, ye te bhikkhū āraññikā piṇḍapātikā paṃsukūlikā yathāsukhaṃ maṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamantū”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.14.eng: And, Upasena, I allow those monks who stay in the wilderness, who eat only almsfood, and who wear rag-robes to visit me whenever they please.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.15.pli: Tena kho pana samayena sambahulā bhikkhū bahidvārakoṭṭhake ṭhitā honti—“mayaṃ āyasmantaṃ upasenaṃ vaṅgantaputtaṃ pācittiyaṃ desāpessāmā”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.15.eng: Upasena and his followers got up from their seats, bowed down, circumambulated the Buddha with their right sides toward him, and left.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.16.pli: Atha kho āyasmā upaseno vaṅgantaputto sapariso uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.16.eng: Just then a number of monks were standing outside the gateway, thinking, “We’ll make Venerable Upasena confess an offense entailing confession.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.16.comm: “Outside the gateway” renders bahidvārakoṭṭhaka (in the previous sentence). See Appendix of Technical Terms for a discussion of the word koṭṭhaka.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.17.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ upasenaṃ vaṅgantaputtaṃ etadavocuṃ—“jānāsi tvaṃ, āvuso upasena, sāvatthiyā saṅghassa katikan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.17.eng: And they said to Upasena, “Upasena, do you know the agreement of the Sangha at Sāvatthī?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.18.pli: “Bhagavāpi maṃ, āvuso, evamāha—‘jānāsi pana tvaṃ, upasena, sāvatthiyā saṅghassa katikan’ti? ‘Na kho ahaṃ, bhante, jānāmi sāvatthiyā saṅghassa katikan’ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.18.eng: “The Buddha asked me the same question, and I replied that I didn’t.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.19.eng: He then told me what it was, and I said,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.21.pli: Na bhagavā kenaci upasaṅkamitabbo, aññatra ekena piṇḍapātanīhārakena.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.22.pli: Yo bhagavantaṃ upasaṅkamati so pācittiyaṃ desāpetabbo’ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.23.eng: ‘Sir, let the Sangha at Sāvatthī be known for this agreement.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.24.pli: na mayaṃ apaññattaṃ paññapessāma paññattaṃ vā na samucchindissāma,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.24.eng: We, however, don’t lay down new rules, nor do we get rid of the existing ones.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.25.eng: We practice and undertake the training rules as they are.’

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.26.pli: Anuññātāvuso, bhagavatā—‘ye te bhikkhū āraññikā piṇḍapātikā paṃsukūlikā yathāsukhaṃ maṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamantū’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.26.eng: Also, the Buddha has allowed those monks who stay in the wilderness, who eat only almsfood, and who wear rag-robes to visit him whenever they please.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.27.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū—“saccaṃ kho āyasmā upaseno āha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.27.eng: Those monks thought, “It’s true what Venerable Upasena says.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.2.28.pli: ‘na apaññattaṃ paññapetabbaṃ, paññattaṃ vā na samucchinditabbaṃ, yathāpaññattesu sikkhāpadesu samādāya vattitabban’”ti.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.1.pli: Assosuṃ kho bhikkhū—“anuññātā kira bhagavatā—‘ye te bhikkhū āraññikā piṇḍapātikā paṃsukūlikā yathāsukhaṃ maṃ dassanāya upasaṅkamantū’”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.1.eng: The monks heard that the Buddha had allowed those monks who stay in the wilderness, who eat only almsfood, and who wear rag-robes to visit him whenever they please.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.2.pli: Te bhagavantaṃ dassanaṃ pihentā santhatāni ujjhitvā āraññikaṅgaṃ piṇḍapātikaṅgaṃ paṃsukūlikaṅgaṃ samādiyiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.2.eng: Longing to see the Buddha, they discarded their blankets and undertook the practice of staying in the wilderness, of eating only almsfood, and of wearing rag-robes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā sambahulehi bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ senāsanacārikaṃ āhiṇḍanto addasa santhatāni tahaṃ tahaṃ ujjhitāni.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.3.eng: Soon afterwards, when the Buddha and a number of monks were walking about the dwellings, he saw discarded blankets here and there.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.4.pli: Passitvā bhikkhū āmantesi—“kassimāni, bhikkhave, santhatāni tahaṃ tahaṃ ujjhitānī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.4.eng: He asked the monks, “Who owns these discarded blankets?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.5.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.6.pli: Atha kho bhagavā etasmiṃ nidāne etasmiṃ pakaraṇe dhammiṃ kathaṃ katvā bhikkhū āmantesi—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.6.eng: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.7.pli: “tena hi, bhikkhave, bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ paññapessāmi dasa atthavase paṭicca—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.7.eng: “Well then, monks, I will lay down a training rule for the following ten reasons:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.8.eng: for the well-being of the Sangha, for the comfort of the Sangha, for the restraint of bad people, for the ease of good monks, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to the present life, for the restraint of the corruptions relating to future lives, to give rise to confidence in those without it, to increase the confidence of those who have it, for the longevity of the true Teaching, and for supporting the training.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.9.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.9.eng: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.10.1.pli: “Nisīdanasanthataṃ pana bhikkhunā kārayamānena purāṇasanthatassa sāmantā sugatavidatthi ādātabbā dubbaṇṇakaraṇāya,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.10.1.eng: ‘If a monk is having a sitting blanket made, he must incorporate a piece of one standard handspan from the border of an old blanket in order to make it ugly.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.11.pli: anādā ce bhikkhu purāṇasanthatassa sāmantā sugatavidatthiṃ navaṃ nisīdanasanthataṃ kārāpeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:1.3.11.eng: If he has a new sitting blanket made without incorporating a piece of one standard handspan from the border of an old blanket, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.1.comm: “Sitting (blanket)” renders nisīdana. See Appendix of Technical Terms for discussion.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.2.eng: one with a border is what is meant.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.4.eng: it is made by strewing, not by weaving.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.6.eng: making it himself or having it made.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.9.eng: He must incorporate a piece of one standard handspan from the border in order to make it ugly:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.10.pli: thirabhāvāya vaṭṭaṃ vā caturassaṃ vā chinditvā ekadese vā santharitabbaṃ vijaṭetvā vā santharitabbaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.10.eng: to make it strong, he cuts out a circular or a rectangular piece, and he then incorporates it in one place or he strews it on after pulling it apart.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.11.pli: Anādā ce bhikkhu purāṇasanthatassa sāmantā sugatavidatthinti
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.11.eng: Without incorporating a piece of one standard handspan from the border of an old blanket:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.12.pli: anādiyitvā purāṇasanthatassa sāmantā sugatavidatthiṃ navaṃ nisīdanasanthataṃ karoti vā kārāpeti vā, payoge dukkaṭaṃ,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.12.eng: if he makes a new sitting blanket, or has one made, without incorporating a piece of one standard handspan from the border of an old blanket, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.13.eng: When he gets the sitting blanket, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.14.pli: Nissajjitabbaṃ saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.14.eng: The sitting blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.15.eng: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.16.eng: (To be expanded as in Bu NP 1:3.2.5–3.2.29, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.17.pli: “idaṃ me, bhante, nisīdanasanthataṃ anādiyitvā purāṇasanthatassa sāmantā sugatavidatthiṃ kārāpitaṃ nissaggiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.17.eng: ‘Venerables, this sitting blanket, which I got made without incorporating a piece of one standard handspan from the border of an old blanket, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.18.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.21.eng: ‘I give this sitting blanket back to you.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.22.1.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.22.1.eng: If he finishes what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.23.pli: Attanā vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.23.eng: If he has others finish what he began himself, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.24.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ attanā pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.24.eng: If he finishes himself what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.25.pli: Parehi vippakataṃ parehi pariyosāpeti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.25.eng: If he has others finish what was begun by others, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.26.pli: Aññassatthāya karoti vā kārāpeti vā, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.26.eng: If he makes one, or has one made, for the sake of another, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.28.eng: if he makes one incorporating a piece of one standard handspan from the border of an old blanket;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.29.eng: if he is unable to get hold of such a piece and he makes one incorporating a smaller piece;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.30.eng: if he is unable to get hold of such a smaller piece and he makes one without;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.31.eng: if he gets what was made by another and then uses it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.32.pli: vitānaṃ vā bhūmattharaṇaṃ vā sāṇipākāraṃ vā bhisiṃ vā bibbohanaṃ vā karoti,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.32.eng: if he makes a canopy, a floor cover, a cloth screen, a mattress, or a pillow;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.34.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np15:2.35.eng: The training rule on sitting blankets, the fifth, is finished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.1.pli: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.1.eng: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena aññatarassa bhikkhuno kosalesu janapade sāvatthiṃ gacchantassa antarāmagge eḷakalomāni uppajjiṃsu.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.2.eng: a certain monk was given wool as he was walking through the Kosalan country on his way to Sāvatthī.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.3.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu tāni eḷakalomāni uttarāsaṅgena bhaṇḍikaṃ bandhitvā agamāsi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.3.eng: He bound it into a bundle with his upper robe and carried on.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.4.eng: People who saw him teased him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.5.eng: “Venerable, how much did it cost you?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.6.eng: How much will the profit be?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.7.pli: So bhikkhu tehi manussehi uppaṇḍiyamāno maṅku ahosi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.7.eng: As a result he was humiliated.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.8.pli: Atha kho so bhikkhu sāvatthiṃ gantvā tāni eḷakalomāni ṭhitakova āsumbhi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.8.eng: When he arrived at Sāvatthī, he threw the wool to the ground.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.10.pli: “kissa tvaṃ, āvuso, imāni eḷakalomāni ṭhitakova āsumbhasī”ti?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.11.pli: “Tathā hi panāhaṃ, āvuso, imesaṃ eḷakalomānaṃ kāraṇā manussehi uppaṇḍito”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.11.eng: “People have been teasing me because of this wool.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.12.pli: “Kīva dūrato pana tvaṃ, āvuso, imāni eḷakalomāni āharī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.12.eng: “But how far have you carried it?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.14.pli: Ye te bhikkhū appicchā …pe… te ujjhāyanti khiyyanti vipācenti—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.14.eng: The monks of few desires complained and criticized him,

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.15.eng: “How could a monk carry wool more than 40 kilometers?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.16.pli: Atha kho te bhikkhū taṃ bhikkhuṃ anekapariyāyena vigarahitvā bhagavato etamatthaṃ ārocesuṃ …pe…
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.16.eng: After rebuking that monk in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.17.pli: “saccaṃ kira tvaṃ, bhikkhu, atirekatiyojanaṃ eḷakalomāni āharī”ti?
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.17.eng: “Is it true, monk, that you did this?”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.20.pli: kathañhi nāma tvaṃ, moghapurisa, atirekatiyojanaṃ eḷakalomāni āharissasi.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.20.eng: “Foolish man, how could you do this?

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.22.pli: evañca pana, bhikkhave, imaṃ sikkhāpadaṃ uddiseyyātha—
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.22.eng: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.23.1.pli: “Bhikkhuno paneva addhānamaggappaṭipannassa eḷakalomāni uppajjeyyuṃ. Ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbāni.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.23.1.eng: ‘If wool is given to a monk who is traveling, he may receive it if he wishes.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.24.pli: Paṭiggahetvā tiyojanaparamaṃ sahatthā haritabbāni, asante hārake.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.24.eng: If he receives it and there is no one else to carry it, he may carry it himself for at most 40 kilometers.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.24.comm: That is, three yojanas. For a discussion of measures and distances, see sugata in Appendix of Technical Terms.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.25.pli: Tato ce uttari hareyya, asantepi hārake, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyan”ti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:1.25.eng: If he carries it further than that, even if there is no one else to carry it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.1.eng: To a monk who is traveling:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.2.eng: to one who is walking on a road.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.4.pli: uppajjeyyuṃ saṅghato vā gaṇato vā ñātito vā mittato vā paṃsukūlaṃ vā attano vā dhanena.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.4.eng: if it is given by a sangha, by a group, by a relative, by a friend, or if it is discarded wool, or if he got it by means of his own property.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.6.eng: if he desires, he may receive it.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.7.eng: If he receives it, he may carry it himself for at most 40 kilometers:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.8.eng: he may carry it himself a maximum of 40 kilometers.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.9.eng: There is no one else to carry it:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.10.pli: nāñño koci hārako hoti itthī vā puriso vā gahaṭṭho vā pabbajito vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.10.eng: there is no other person who can carry it, either a woman or a man, either a lay person or a monastic.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.11.pli: Tato ce uttari hareyya, asantepi hāraketi
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.11.eng: If he carries it further than that, even if there is no one else to carry it:

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.12.pli: paṭhamaṃ pādaṃ tiyojanaṃ atikkāmeti, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.12.eng: when he goes beyond 40 kilometers with the first foot, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.13.eng: When he goes beyond with the second foot, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.14.pli: Antotiyojane ṭhito bahitiyojanaṃ pāteti, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.14.eng: If he stands within the 40 kilometer limit, but drops it beyond the 40 kilometer limit, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.15.pli: Aññassa yāne vā bhaṇḍe vā ajānantassa pakkhipitvā tiyojanaṃ atikkāmeti, nissaggiyāni honti.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.15.eng: If he places it in the vehicle or among the goods of another without their knowledge, and it goes more than 40 kilometers, it becomes subject to relinquishment.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.16.pli: Nissajjitabbāni saṅghassa vā gaṇassa vā puggalassa vā.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.16.eng: The wool should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.17.eng: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.18.eng: (To be expanded as in Bu NP 1:3.2.5–3.2.29, with appropriate substitutions.)

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.19.pli: “imāni me, bhante, eḷakalomāni tiyojanaṃ atikkāmitāni nissaggiyāni.
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.19.eng: ‘Venerables, this wool, which I have taken more than 40 kilometers, is to be relinquished.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.20.eng: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.23.eng: ‘I give this wool back to you.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.24.1.eng: If he takes it more than 40 kilometers and he perceives it as more, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.25.eng: If he takes it more than 40 kilometers, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.26.eng: If he takes it more than 40 kilometers, but he perceives it as less, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.27.eng: If he takes it less than 40 kilometers, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.28.eng: If he takes it less than 40 kilometers, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.29.eng: If he takes it less than 40 kilometers and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.32.eng: if he carries it less than 40 kilometers;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.33.eng: if he carries it 40 kilometers and then carries it back;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.34.pli: tiyojanaṃ vāsādhippāyo gantvā tato paraṃ harati,
pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.34.eng: if he takes it 40 kilometers with the intention of staying there, but then takes it further;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.35.eng: if he gets back what had been taken from him and then carries it on;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.36.eng: if he gets back what he had given up and then carries it on;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.37.eng: if he gets someone else to carry it;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.38.eng: if it is a finished article;

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.40.eng: if he is the first offender.

pli-tv-bu-vb-np16:2.41.eng: The training rule on wool, the sixth, is finished.
